headline.main: New Allies: One Trusts, The Other's Not So Sure

lead_paragraph: Ronald Reagan used to say about arms control agreements with the Soviet Union: ''Trust but verify.'' President Bush altered that formula today in a joint appearance with Russian President Vladimir V. Putin, describing the new relationship with Russia as one based on ''cooperation and trust.''
abstract: Analysis of Pres Bush's meeting with Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin notes it is Bush who wants arms cuts based on trust, while Putin wants written accord on cutting strategic nuclear arms before he agrees to alter Antiballistic Missile Treaty; differing approaches underscore how two leaders are struggling to define boundaries of fast-evolving relationship in wake of Sept 11 terror attacks (M)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: ARMS CONTROL AND LIMITATION AND DISARMAMENT
